conclusion: Determine the electric field at the intersection of the diagonals by analyzing charges at each vertex.
Square ABCD with side length L, +q charges at A and B, -q charges at C and D, diagonals intersect inside.
Square ABCD has side length L and diagonal intersection point O.
Charges are placed at each vertex: +q at A and B, -q at C and D.
At point O, the electric field is influenced by charges +q at A and B, and charges -q at C and D.
Distance from each vertex to point O is the same since O is the midpoint of each diagonal.
Electric field due to each charge is calculated using Coulomb's law: E = k * q / r^2.
Since distances from each vertex to point O are equal, magnitude of electric field due to each pair of charges is equal.
Total electric field at point O is the sum of the fields from the charges +q and -q.
Fields due to +q and -q are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction, so total electric field at O is zero.
The electric field at the intersection point of the diagonals is 0.
